meanings.definition: An additional name or nickname, especially one given in honor of a notable achievement or characteristic.
meanings.sent1: Her agnomen 'Star' was earned after she won the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The agnomen 'Braveheart' was bestowed upon him for his courage in battle.
meanings.sent3: Everyone laughed when his agnomen 'Speedy' turned out to be ironic.
meanings.sent4: The agnomen 'Whisper' clung to her, reflecting her quiet nature.
meanings.sent5: The agnomen 'Golden Voice' made him stand out among singers.

meanings.sent1: Smith is a common agnomen in English-speaking countries.
meanings.sent2: The agnomen 'Johnson' has a long history in his family.
meanings.sent3: Their agnomen 'Green' doesn't mean they are all environmentalists.
meanings.sent4: The agnomen 'Stone' symbolizes their family's strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The agnomen 'Silver' hints at their ancestors' profession as silversmiths.
